1.verse: The Word Was With God, And The Word Was God. He Is The Light Shining In The Darkness - In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

2.verse: This One was in the beginning with God.

3.verse: All things came-into-being through Him, and apart from Him not even one thing came into being which has come-into-being.

4.verse: In Him was life, and the life was the light of mankind.

5.verse: And the light is shining in the darkness, and the darkness did not overcome it.

6.verse: John Was Sent By God To Bear Witness To The Light In Order That All Might Believe - There came-to-be a man, having been sent-forth from God. The name for him was John.

7.verse: This one came for a testimony— in order that he might testify concerning the Light, in order that all might believe through him.

8.verse: That one was not the Light, but came in order that he might testify concerning the Light—

9.verse: the true Light which gives-light-to every person was coming into the world.

10.verse: The World Did Not Accept The Light, But All Who Did Became Children of God - He was in the world, and the world came-into-being through Him, and the world did not know Him.

11.verse: He came to His own things, and His own ones did not accept Him.

12.verse: But all who did receive Him, He gave them— the ones believing in His name— the right to become children of God,

13.verse: who were born not of bloods, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of a husband, but of God.

14.verse: The Word Became Flesh And We Saw His Unique Glory. John Bore Witness To Him - And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we saw His glory— glory as of the only-born from the Father, full of grace and truth.

15.verse: John testifies concerning Him, and has cried-out saying, “This One was the One of Whom I said, ‘The One coming after me has become ahead of me, because He was before me’”.

16.verse: We All Received From The Fullness of Grace And Truth He Brought - Because we all received from His fullness— even grace upon grace.

17.verse: Because the Law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

18.verse: The Only-Born God Revealed The Father To Us - No one has ever seen God; the only-born God, the One being in the bosom of the Father— that One expounded Him.

19.verse: John Came Baptizing To Make Straight The Way of The Lord, As Isaiah Prophesied - And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews from Jerusalem sent-out priests and Levites to him in order that they might ask him, “Who are you?”,

20.verse: and he confessed and did not deny. And he confessed that “I am not the Christ”,

21.verse: and they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” And he says, “I am not”. “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No”.

22.verse: Then they said to him, “Who are you, in order that we may give an answer to the ones having sent us? What do you say about yourself ?”

23.verse: He said, “I am the ‘voice of one shouting in the wilderness: “Make-straight the way of the Lord”’, just as Isaiah the prophet said [in Isa 40:3]”.

24.verse: And they had been sent-out from the Pharisees.

25.verse: And they asked him, and said to him, “Why then are you baptizing if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”

26.verse: John responded to them saying, “I am baptizing with water. Amidst you stands One Whom you do not know—

27.verse: the One coming after me, of Whom I am not worthy that I may untie the strap of His sandal”.

28.verse: These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

29.verse: John Identifies Jesus As The Son of God Sent To Take Away The Sin of The World - On the next day he sees Jesus coming toward him. And he says, “Look— the Lamb of God, the One taking-away the sin of the world.

30.verse: This One is the One about Whom I said, ‘A man is coming after me Who has become ahead of me, because He was before me’.

31.verse: And I did not know Him. But I came baptizing with water for this reason— that He might be revealed to Israel”.

32.verse: And John testified, saying that “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove out of heaven. And He remained upon Him.

33.verse: And I did not know Him. But the One having sent me to baptize with water, that One said to me, ‘Upon whomever you see the Spirit descending and remaining upon Him— this One is the One baptizing with the Holy Spirit’.

34.verse: And I have seen, and have testified that this One is the Son of God”.

35.verse: John Points His Disciples To The Lamb of God. Andrew And Peter Find The Messiah - On the next day John was again standing there, and two of his disciples.

36.verse: And having looked at Jesus walking, he says, “Look— the Lamb of God”.

37.verse: And the two disciples heard him speaking, and followed Jesus.

38.verse: And Jesus, having turned and seen them following, says to them, “What are you seeking?” And the ones said to Him, “Rabbi (which being translated means “Teacher”), where are You staying?”

39.verse: He says to them, “Come, and you will see”. So they went, and saw where He was staying, and stayed with Him that day. The hour was about the tenth.

40.verse: Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two having heard it from John, and having followed Him.

41.verse: This one first finds his own brother Simon, and says to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which being translated is “Christ”).

42.verse: He brought him to Jesus. Having looked-at him, Jesus said, “You are Simon, the son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which is translated “Peter”).

43.verse: Jesus Finds Philip, Who Finds Nathanael. They Follow The Son of God, The King of Israel - On the next day He wanted to go forth to Galilee. And He finds Philip. And Jesus says to him, “Be following Me”.

44.verse: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.

45.verse: Philip finds Nathanael and says to him, “We have found the One of whom Moses wrote in the Law, and the Prophets wrote— Jesus, son of Joseph, from Nazareth”.

46.verse: And Nathanael said to him, “Is anything good able to be out of Nazareth?” Philip says to him, “Come and see”.

47.verse: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and says about him, “Look— truly an Israelite in whom there is no deceit”.

48.verse: Nathanael says to Him, “From where do You know me?” Jesus responded and said to him, “Before Philip called you, while being under the fig tree, I saw you”.

49.verse: Nathanael responded to Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God. You are the King of Israel”.

50.verse: Jesus responded and said to him, “Do you believe because I said to you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than these!”

51.verse: And He says to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you all, you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man”.

1.verse: They All Visit a Wedding, Where Jesus Reveals His Glory By Turning Water Into Wine - And on the third day a wedding took place in Cana of Galilee. And the mother of Jesus was there.

2.verse: And both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding-celebration.

3.verse: And it having come-short-of wine, the mother of Jesus says to Him, “They do not have wine”.

4.verse: And Jesus says to her, “What do I have to do with you, woman? My hour has not yet come”.

5.verse: His mother says to the servants, “Do whatever thing He says to you”.

6.verse: Now six stone waterpots were setting there for the purification [rite] of the Jews, each having-room-for two or three measures.

7.verse: Jesus says to them, “Fill the waterpots with water”. And they filled them up to the top.

8.verse: And He says to them, “Draw some now, and carry it to the headwaiter”. And the ones carried it.

9.verse: And when the headwaiter tasted the water having become wine— and he did not know where it was from, but the servants having drawn the water knew— the headwaiter calls the bridegroom,

10.verse: and says to him, “Every person first puts out the fine wine, and when they get-drunk, the lesser. You have kept the fine wine until now”.

11.verse: Jesus did this beginning of signs in Cana of Galilee, and revealed His glory. And His disciples believed in Him.

12.verse: After this He went down to Capernaum— He and His mother and His brothers and His disciples. And they stayed there not many days.

13.verse: At The Passover, Consumed By Zeal For God’s House, Jesus Cleanses The Temple - And the Passover [Feast] of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

14.verse: And in the temple, He found the ones selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers-of-money sitting [at their tables].

15.verse: And having made a lash from ropes, He drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep and the oxen. And He poured-out the coin of the money-changers. And He overturned the tables.

16.verse: And He said to the ones selling the doves, “Take these things from here. Do not be making the house of My Father a house of a market”.

17.verse: His disciples remembered that it has been written [in Ps 69:9], “Zeal for Your house will consume Me”.

18.verse: Then the Jews responded and said to Him, “What sign do You show us, that you are doing these things?”

19.verse: Jesus responded and said to them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it”.

20.verse: Then the Jews said, “This temple was built for forty and six years, and You will raise it in three days?”

21.verse: But that One was speaking about the temple of His body.

22.verse: So when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He was saying this, and believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus spoke.

23.verse: Many Believed, But Jesus Did Not Entrust Himself To Them - Now while He was in Jerusalem at the Passover during the Feast, many believed in His name, seeing His signs which He was doing.

24.verse: But Jesus Himself was not entrusting Himself to them— because of His knowing all people;

25.verse: and because He was having no need that someone should testify about the person, for He Himself was knowing what was in the person.

1.verse: Nicodemus, a Ruler of The Jews, Comes To Jesus, And Is Told He Must Be Born Again - Now there was a man from the Pharisees— the name for him was Nicodemus— a ruler of the Jews.

2.verse: This one came to Him by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You have come from God as a teacher. For no one is able to be doing these signs which You are doing unless God is with him”.

3.verse: Jesus responded and said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you— unless one is born again, he is not able to see the kingdom of God”.

4.verse: Nicodemus says to Him, “How is a person able to be born while being an old-man? He is not able to enter a second time into the womb of his mother and be born, is he?”

5.verse: Jesus responded, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he is not able to enter into the kingdom of God.

6.verse: The thing having been born of the flesh is flesh, and the thing having been born of the Spirit is spirit.

7.verse: Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You all must be born again’—

8.verse: the wind blows where it wants, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know from where it comes, and where it is going. So is everyone having been born of the Spirit”.

9.verse: Nicodemus responded and said to Him, “How are these things able to happen?”

10.verse: Jesus responded and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel and you do not understand these things?

11.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you that we are speaking what we know, and we are testifying what we have seen, and you people are not receiving our testimony.

12.verse: If I told you people earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?

13.verse: And no one has gone up into heaven except the One having come down from heaven— the Son of Man.

14.verse: And just as Moses lifted-up the serpent in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up

15.verse: in order that everyone putting-faith in Him may have eternal life.

16.verse: God Sent His Son Into The World That All Believing In Him May Have Eternal Life - “For God so loved the world that He gave His only-born Son, in order that everyone believing in Him may not perish, but may have eternal life.

17.verse: For God did not send-forth the Son into the world in order that He might judge the world, but in order that the world might be saved through Him.

18.verse: The one believing in Him is not judged. But the one not believing has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only-born Son of God.

19.verse: And this is the judgment: that the Light has come into the world, and people loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their works were evil.

20.verse: For everyone practicing bad things hates the Light, and does not come to the Light in order that his works may not be exposed.

21.verse: But the one doing the truth comes to the Light in order that his works may become-visible— that they have been worked in God”.

22.verse: Jesus Goes To Judea. John The Baptist Declares Himself The Friend of The Bridegroom - After these things Jesus and His disciples went into the Judean land, and there He was spending-time with them and baptizing.

23.verse: Now John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there were many waters there. And they were coming and being baptized.

24.verse: For John had not yet been thrown into prison.

25.verse: Then a debate arose from the disciples of John with a Jew about purification.

26.verse: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, concerning Whom you have testified, look— this One is baptizing, and all are going to Him!”

27.verse: John responded and said “A person cannot receive even one thing unless it has been given to him from heaven.

28.verse: You yourselves are testifying concerning me that I said that ‘I am not the Christ’, but that ‘I am one having been sent-forth ahead of that One’.

29.verse: The one having the bride is the bridegroom. And the friend of the bridegroom, the one standing there and hearing him, rejoices with joy because of the voice of the bridegroom. So this, my joy, has been made-full.

30.verse: It-is-necessary for that One to grow, and for me to diminish.

31.verse: Jesus Has Come From Heaven With The Words of God. He Is Above All - “The One coming from-above is above all. The one being from the earth is from the earth and is speaking from the earth. The One coming from heaven is above all.

32.verse: What He has seen and did hear— this He is testifying. And no one is receiving His testimony.

33.verse: The one having received His testimony certified that God is truthful,

34.verse: for He Whom God sent forth is speaking the words of God. For He does not give Him the Spirit from a measure.

35.verse: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things in His hand.

36.verse: The one believing in the Son has eternal life. But the one disobeying the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God remains on him”.

1.verse: Jesus Goes To Galilee - So when Jesus knew that the Pharisees heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John

2.verse: (although Jesus Himself was not baptizing, but His disciples),

3.verse: He left Judea and went again toward Galilee.

4.verse: And He had-to go through Samaria.

5.verse: On The Way, Jesus Stops At a Well In Samaria - So He comes into a city of Samaria being called Sychar, near the place which Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

6.verse: Now a spring of Jacob was there. So Jesus, having become weary from the journey, was sitting thus at the spring. The hour was about the sixth.

7.verse: He Talks With a Woman At The Well, And Tells Her He Is The Awaited Messiah - A woman of Samaria comes to draw water. Jesus says to her, “Give Me water to drink”.

8.verse: For His disciples had gone into the city in order that they might buy food.

9.verse: So the Samaritan woman says to Him, “How is it You, being a Jew, are asking something to drink from me, being a Samaritan woman?” For Jews do not use-things-together-with Samaritans.

10.verse: Jesus responded and said to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and Who the One saying to you ‘Give Me water to drink’ is— you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water”.

11.verse: The woman says to Him, “Sir, You have no bucket and the well is deep. From where then do You have the living water?

12.verse: You are not greater than our father Jacob, are You, who gave us the well, and himself drank from it, and his sons, and his animals?”

13.verse: Jesus responded and said to her, “Everyone drinking from this water will thirst again.

14.verse: But whoever should drink from the water which I will give him— he will never thirst, ever. On the contrary, the water which I will give him will become a spring of water in him, bubbling-up to eternal life”.

15.verse: The woman says to Him, “Sir, give me this water in order that I may not be thirsting, nor coming here to draw it”.

16.verse: He says to her, “Go, call your husband and come here”.

17.verse: The woman responded and said to Him, “I do not have a husband”. Jesus says to her, “You said rightly that ‘I do not have a husband’.

18.verse: For you had five husbands. And now he whom you have is not your husband. You have spoken this as a true thing”.

19.verse: The woman says to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.

20.verse: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you Jews say that the place where one must worship is in Jerusalem”.

21.verse: Jesus says to her, “Believe Me, woman, that an hour is coming when you Samaritans will give-worship to the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.

22.verse: You Samaritans worship what you do not know. We Jews worship what we know, because salvation is from the Jews.

23.verse: But an hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will give-worship to the Father in spirit and truth. For indeed the Father is seeking such ones to be the ones worshiping Him.

24.verse: God is spirit, and the ones worshiping Him must worship in spirit and truth”.

25.verse: The woman says to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming— the One being called Christ. When that One comes, He will declare all things to us”.

26.verse: Jesus says to her, “I, the One speaking to you, am He”.

27.verse: The Disciples Marvel That He Was Speaking With a Woman - And at this point His disciples came, and they were marveling that He was speaking with a woman. Yet no one said, “What are you seeking?” or, “Why are You speaking with her?”

28.verse: So the woman left her waterpot, and went into the city. And she says to the people,

29.verse: “Come, see a man Who told me everything that I did. This One is not the Christ, is He?”

30.verse: They went out of the city, and were coming to Him.

31.verse: Jesus Explains: I Came To Do God’s Will. The Harvest Is Ripe - In the meantime the disciples were asking Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat”.

32.verse: But the One said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about”.

33.verse: So the disciples were saying to one another, “Someone did not bring Him something to eat, did he?”

34.verse: Jesus says to them, “My food is that I may do the will of the One having sent Me, and accomplish His work.

35.verse: Do you not say that ‘There are still four months, and the harvest comes’? Behold, I say to you— lift-up your eyes and look-at the fields, that they are white for harvest. Already

36.verse: the one reaping is receiving wages, and is gathering fruit for life eternal, so that the one sowing and the one reaping may rejoice together.

37.verse: For in this case the saying is true, that ‘One is the one sowing and another is the one reaping.

38.verse: I sent you out to be reaping what you have not labored-for. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor”.

39.verse: Many Samaritans Believe His Message After Hearing His Words - And many of the Samaritans from that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman testifying that “He told me everything which I did”.

40.verse: Therefore when the Samaritans came to Him, they were asking Him to stay with them. And He stayed there for two days.

41.verse: And many more believed because of His word.

42.verse: And they were saying to the woman that “We are no longer believing because of your speaking. For we ourselves have heard, and we know that this One is truly the Savior of the world”.

43.verse: And after the two days, He went forth from there to Galilee.

44.verse: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet does not have honor in his own homeland.

45.verse: Arriving In Galilee, a Royal Jew Believes After Jesus Heals His Son - So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed Him, having seen all that He did in Jerusalem at the Feast. For they also went to the Feast.

46.verse: So He came again to Cana of Galilee, where He made the water wine. And there was a certain royal one whose son was sick in Capernaum.

47.verse: This one, having heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, went to Him, and was asking that He come down and heal his son. For he was about to die.

48.verse: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will by no means believe”.

49.verse: The royal one says to Him, “Master, come down before my child dies”.

50.verse: Jesus says to him, “Go, your son lives”. The man believed the word which Jesus spoke to him, and was going.

51.verse: Now while he was already going down, his slaves met him, saying that his boy lives.

52.verse: So he inquired from them the hour at which he got better. So they said to him that “The fever left him yesterday at the seventh hour”.

53.verse: Then the father knew that it was at that hour at which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives”. And he believed, he and his whole household.

54.verse: Now this again was a second sign Jesus did, having come from Judea to Galilee.

1.verse: Jesus Goes To Jerusalem For a Feast, And Heals a Man On The Sabbath - After these things there was a Feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

2.verse: Now in Jerusalem near the Sheep gate, there is a pool— the one being called Bethzatha in Hebrew, having five porticos.

3.verse: In these porticos, a multitude of the ones being sick were lying-down— blind ones, lame ones, withered ones.

5.verse: And there was a certain man there having thirty and eight years in his sickness.

6.verse: Jesus— having seen this one lying down, and having known that he already had a long time [in his sickness]— says to him, “Do you want to become healthy?”

7.verse: The one being sick answered Him, “Sir, I do not have a man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred-up. But while I am going, another goes down before me”.

8.verse: Jesus says to him, “Arise, pick up your cot and walk!”

9.verse: And immediately the man became healthy, and picked up his cot and was walking. They Want To Kill Jesus Because He Breaks The Sabbath And Makes Himself Equal To God -Now it was a Sabbath on that day.

10.verse: So the Jews were saying to the one having been cured, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not lawful for you to pick up your cot”.

11.verse: But the one answered them, “The One having made me healthy, that One said to me, ‘Pick up your cot and walk’”.

12.verse: They asked him, “Who is the man having said to you, ‘Pick up and walk’?”

13.verse: But the one having been healed did not know who He was. For Jesus withdrew, a crowd being in the place.

14.verse: After these things, Jesus finds him in the temple. And He said to him, “See— you have become healthy! Do not be sinning any longer in order that something worse may not happen to you”.

15.verse: The man went away and reported to the Jews that Jesus was the One having made him healthy.

16.verse: And for this reason, the Jews were persecuting Jesus— because He was doing these things on a Sabbath.

17.verse: But Jesus answered them, “My Father is working until now, and I am working”.

18.verse: Therefore, for this reason the Jews were seeking more to kill Him: because He was not only breaking the Sabbath, but He was also calling God His own Father, making Himself equal to God!

19.verse: Therefore Jesus responded and was saying to them— Jesus Responds Regarding His Work: The Son Does Only What The Father Does -“Truly, truly, I say to you— the Son can do nothing from Himself except something He sees the Father doing. For whatever things that One is doing, these things the Son is also likewise doing.

20.verse: For the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself is doing. And He will show Him greater works than these, in order that you may marvel.

21.verse: The Son Raises And Judges The Dead, And Thus Is Due Equal Honor With God - “For just as the Father raises the dead and gives-life-to them, so also the Son gives-life-to the ones whom He wishes.

22.verse: For the Father does not even judge anyone, but He has given all judgment to the Son,

23.verse: in order that all may honor the Son just-as they are honoring the Father. The one not honoring the Son is not honoring the Father having sent Him.

24.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you that the one hearing My word and believing the One having sent Me has eternal life. And he does not come into judgment, but has passed from death to life.

25.verse: The Son Has Life In Himself And Gives Life To The Spiritually Dead - “Truly, truly, I say to you that an hour is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and the ones having heard will live.

26.verse: For just as the Father has life in Himself, so also He gave to the Son to have life in Himself.

27.verse: And He gave Him authority to execute judgment, because He is a son of man.

28.verse: The Son Will Give Life To The Physically Dead - Do not be marveling-at this, because an hour is coming in which all the ones in the graves will hear His voice,

29.verse: and will come out— the ones having done the good things to a resurrection of life; the ones having practiced the bad things to a resurrection of judgment.

30.verse: I Am Doing The Will of The One Who Sent Me - “I can do nothing from Myself. Just as I am hearing, I am judging. And My judgment is righteous, because I am not seeking My will, but the will of the One having sent Me.

31.verse: Jesus Responds Regarding His Identity: Others Testify About Him - “If I am testifying about Myself, My testimony is not true.

32.verse: There is Another— the One testifying about Me— and I know that the testimony which He is testifying about Me is true.

33.verse: John The Baptist Testified - “You have sent out messengers to John, and he has testified to the truth.

34.verse: But I do not receive testimony from a human. Nevertheless, I am saying these things in order that you may be saved.

35.verse: That one was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to be overjoyed in his light for an hour.

36.verse: Three Greater Witnesses Testify: My Works, The Father, And The Scriptures - “But I have testimony greater than John’s. For the works which the Father has given to Me that I should accomplish them— the works themselves which I am doing are testifying about Me, that the Father has sent Me forth.

37.verse: And the Father having sent Me— that One has testified about Me. Neither His voice have you ever heard, nor His form have you seen.

38.verse: And you do not have His word abiding in you, because the One Whom that One sent-forth— this One you are not believing!

39.verse: You search the Scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life— and those Scriptures are the ones testifying about Me!

40.verse: And you are not willing to come to Me in order that you may have life.

41.verse: But You Are Not Receiving Me Because You Do Not Love God - “I do not receive glory from people,

42.verse: but I know you— that you do not have the love of God in yourselves.

43.verse: I have come in the name of My Father, and you are not receiving Me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive that one.

44.verse: How are you able to believe while receiving glory from one another, and you are not seeking the glory from the only God?

45.verse: Moses Will Be Your Accuser. For If You Believed Him, You Would Believe Me - Do not be thinking that I will accuse you before the Father. The one accusing you is Moses, in whom you have put-hope.

46.verse: For if you were believing Moses, you would be believing Me, for that one wrote about Me.

47.verse: But if you do not believe the writings of that one, how will you believe My words?”

1.verse: Jesus Returns To Galilee And Feeds The 5000 - After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee— of Tiberias.

2.verse: And a large crowd was following Him, because they were seeing the signs which He was doing on the ones being sick.

3.verse: And Jesus went up on the mountain, and was sitting there with His disciples.

4.verse: And the Passover, the Feast of the Jews, was near.

5.verse: Then Jesus, having lifted-up His eyes and seen that a large crowd was coming to Him, says to Philip, “From where may we buy bread in order that these ones may eat?”

6.verse: Now He was saying this testing him. For He Himself knew what He was going to do.

7.verse: Philip answered Him, “Loaves worth two-hundred denarii are not enough for them, in order that each one may receive a little bit”.

8.verse: One of His disciples— Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter— says to Him,

9.verse: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these for so many?”

10.verse: Jesus said, “Make the people fall-back [to eat]”. And there was much grass in the place. So the men— about five-thousand as to the number— fell back [to eat].

11.verse: Then Jesus took the loaves. And having given-thanks, He distributed them to the ones reclining-back [to eat]— likewise also from the fish— as much as they were wanting.

12.verse: And when they were filled, He says to His disciples, “Gather the left-over fragments so that nothing may be lost”.

13.verse: So they gathered, and filled twelve baskets of fragments from the five barley loaves, which were left over by the ones having eaten.

14.verse: Therefore the people, having seen the sign which He did, were saying that “This One is truly the Prophet coming into the world”.

15.verse: Then Jesus, having known that they were about to come and take Him away-by-force in order that they might make Him king, withdrew again to the mountain, Himself alone.

16.verse: Jesus Walks On Water To Capernaum - Now when it became evening, His disciples went down to the sea.

17.verse: And having gotten into a boat, they were going to the other side of the sea, to Capernaum. And darkness already had come, and Jesus had not-yet come to them.

18.verse: And the sea was becoming aroused from a great wind blowing.

19.verse: So having rowed about twenty five or thirty stades, they see Jesus walking on the sea and becoming near the boat. And they became afraid.

20.verse: But the One says to them, “I am the One. Do not be afraid”.

21.verse: So they were willing to take Him into the boat. And immediately the boat came-to-be at the land to which they were going.

22.verse: The Crowd Follows Him There - On the next day the crowd standing on the other side of the sea saw that there had not been another small boat there except [the] one, and that Jesus had not entered into the boat with His disciples, but His disciples had gone away alone.

23.verse: Other small-boats came from Tiberias near the place where they ate the bread, the Lord having given-thanks.

24.verse: So when the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they got into the small boats, and went to Capernaum seeking Jesus.

25.verse: Jesus Says, Work For The Food Leading To Eternal Life, Which The Son Will Give You - And having found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when have You come here?”

26.verse: Jesus responded to them and said, “Truly, truly, I say to you— you are seeking Me not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves-of-bread and were filled-to-satisfaction.

27.verse: Do not be working for the food which is perishing, but for the food which is remaining to eternal life— which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father certified this One”.

28.verse: The Work God Requires of You Is To Believe In The One Sent Forth By God - So they said to Him, “What may we be doing in order that we may be working the works of God?”

29.verse: Jesus responded and said to them, “This is the work of God: that you be believing in the One Whom that One sent-forth”.

30.verse: My Father Is Giving You The True Bread From Heaven, Which Came To Give Life - So they said to Him, “What then do You do as a sign, in order that we may see it and believe You? What thing do you work?

31.verse: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it has been written [in Ps 78:24]: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat’”.

32.verse: So Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, Moses has not given you the bread from heaven, but My Father is giving you the true Bread from heaven.

33.verse: For the bread of God is the One coming down from heaven and giving life to the world”.

34.verse: I Am The Bread of Life Come From Heaven. He Who Believes In Me Has Eternal Life - So they said to Him, “Master, give us this bread always”.

35.verse: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. The one coming to Me will never hunger, and the one believing in Me will never ever thirst.

36.verse: But I said to you that you have indeed seen Me, and you are not believing.

37.verse: All that the Father gives to Me will come to Me, and I will never throw outside the one coming to Me.

38.verse: Because I have come down from heaven not in order that I may be doing My will, but the will of the One having sent Me.

39.verse: And this is the will of the One having sent Me: that as to all that He has given to Me, I will not lose anything from it, but I will raise it up on the last day.

40.verse: For this is the will of My Father: that everyone seeing the Son and believing in Him may have eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day”.

41.verse: I Am The Living Bread From Heaven: Eat And Live Forever. The Bread Is My Flesh - Then the Jews were grumbling about Him because He said, “I am the bread having come down from heaven”.

42.verse: And they were saying, “Is this One not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How does He now say that ‘I have come down from heaven’?”

43.verse: Jesus responded and said to them, “Do not be grumbling with one another.

44.verse: No one is able to come to Me unless the Father having sent Me draws him. And I will raise him up on the last day.

45.verse: It has been written in the prophets [in Isa 54:13]: ‘and they shall all be taught ones of God’. Everyone having heard from the Father and having learned, comes to Me—

46.verse: not that anyone has seen the Father, except the One being from God; this One has seen the Father.

47.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you— the one believing has eternal life.

48.verse: I am the bread of life.

49.verse: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness and died.

50.verse: This is the bread coming down from heaven in order that anyone may eat of it and not die.

51.verse: I am the living bread having come down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. And indeed the bread which I will give for the life of the world is My flesh”.

52.verse: My Flesh Is True Food; My Blood Is True Drink. Partake And Live Forever - Then the Jews were fighting with one another, saying, “How can this One give us His flesh to eat?”

53.verse: So Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you do not have life in yourselves.

54.verse: The one eating My flesh and drinking My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.

55.verse: For My flesh is true food, and My blood is true drink.

56.verse: The one eating My flesh and drinking My blood abides in Me, and I in him.

57.verse: Just as the living Father sent Me forth, and I live because of the Father, indeed the one eating Me— that one also will live because of Me.

58.verse: This is the bread having come down from heaven; not as the manna the fathers ate and died. The one eating this bread will live forever”.

59.verse: He said these things in a synagogue while teaching in Capernaum.

60.verse: These Words Are Spirit And Life. But Some of You Disciples Do Not Believe - Then many of His disciples, having heard, said, “This statement is hard. Who can hear it?”

61.verse: But Jesus, knowing in Himself that His disciples are grumbling about this, said to them, “Does this offend you?

62.verse: Then what if you see the Son of Man going up where He was formerly?

63.verse: The Spirit is the One giving-life. The flesh profits nothing. The words which I have spoken to you are spirit, and are life.

64.verse: But there are some of you who do not believe”. For Jesus knew from the beginning who the ones not believing were, and who the one who will hand Him over was.

65.verse: And He was saying, “For this reason I have said to you that no one is able to come to Me unless it has been granted to him from the Father”.

66.verse: From This Time, Many of His Disciples No Longer Followed Him - From this time, many of His disciples went back, and were no longer walking with Him.

67.verse: So Jesus said to the twelve, “You also are not wanting to go-away, are you?”

68.verse: Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.

69.verse: And we have believed, and have come-to-know that You are the Holy One of God”.

70.verse: Jesus answered them, “Did I not choose you, the twelve, and one of you is the devil?”

71.verse: Now He was speaking-of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot. For this one, one of the twelve, was going to hand Him over.

1.verse: Jesus Remained In Galilee Because They Were Seeking To Kill Him In Judea - And after these things Jesus was walking in Galilee. For He was not willing to be walking in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill Him.

2.verse: Jesus Goes To Jerusalem For The Feast of Tabernacles - Now the Tent-pitching Feast of the Jews was near.

3.verse: So His brothers said to Him, “Pass-on from here and go to Judea, so that Your disciples [there] also will see Your works which You are doing.

4.verse: For no one does something in secret and himself seeks to be in public. If You are doing these things, make Yourself known to the world”.

5.verse: (For not even His brothers were believing in Him).

6.verse: So Jesus says to them, “My time is not yet here, but your time is always ready.

7.verse: The world cannot hate you, but it is hating Me because I am testifying about it that its works are evil.

8.verse: You go up to the Feast. I am not going up to this Feast, because My time has not yet been fulfilled”.

9.verse: And having said these things, He remained in Galilee.

10.verse: But when His brothers went up to the Feast, then He also went up— not openly, but as in secret.

11.verse: Then the Jews were seeking-for Him at the Feast, and saying “Where is that One?”

12.verse: And there was much grumbling about Him among the crowds. Some were saying that “He is good”. But others were saying, “No, but He is deceiving the crowd”.

13.verse: Yet no one was speaking with openness about Him because of fear of the Jews.

14.verse: In The Middle of The Feast, Jesus Began Teaching In The Temple: - Now the Feast already being-at-the-middle, Jesus went up to the temple, and was teaching.

15.verse: My Teaching Is From God And For His Glory. Why Do You Want To Kill Me? - Then the Jews were marveling, saying, “How does this One know writings, not having learned?”

16.verse: So Jesus responded to them and said “My teaching is not Mine, but the One’s having sent Me.

17.verse: If anyone is willing to be doing His will, he will know about the teaching— whether it is from God, or I am speaking from Myself.

18.verse: The one speaking from himself is seeking his own glory. But the One seeking the glory of the One having sent Him— this One is true, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.

19.verse: Has not Moses given you the Law? And none of you is doing the Law! Why are you seeking to kill Me?”

20.verse: Do Not Judge According To Appearance - The crowd answered, “You have a demon! Who is seeking to kill You?”

21.verse: Jesus responded and said to them, “I did one work, and you all marvel!

22.verse: For this reason Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but it is from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on a Sabbath.

23.verse: If a man receives circumcision on a Sabbath in order that the Law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry at Me because I made an entire man sound on a Sabbath?

24.verse: Do not be judging according to appearance, but be judging the righteous judgment”.

25.verse: The God Whom You Do Not Know Sent Me To You - Then some of the people-of-Jerusalem were saying, “Is not this the One Whom they are seeking to kill?

26.verse: And look— He is speaking in public, and they are saying nothing to Him. The rulers did not perhaps really know that this One is the Christ, did they?

27.verse: However, we know where this One is from. But when the Christ is coming, no one knows where He is from”.

28.verse: So Jesus cried-out while teaching in the temple and saying, “You both know Me and You know where I am from. And I have not come of Myself. However, the One having sent Me is true— Whom you do not know.

29.verse: I know Him, because I am from Him. And that One sent Me forth”.

30.verse: Therefore they were seeking to seize Him. And no one put his hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.

31.verse: I Will Be With You a Short Time Longer, Then I Am Returning To God - But many from the crowd believed in Him. And they were saying, “When the Christ comes, He will not do more signs than the ones which this One did, will He?”

32.verse: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about Him. And the chief priests and the Pharisees sent out officers in order that they might seize Him.

33.verse: So Jesus said, “I am with you a short time longer, and [then] I am going to the One having sent Me.

34.verse: You will seek Me, and will not find Me. And where I am, you are not able to come”.

35.verse: Then the Jews said to themselves, “Where is this One going to go that we will not find Him? He is not going to go to the Dispersion of the Greeks and teach the Greeks, is He?

36.verse: What is this statement that He said: ‘You will seek Me and will not find Me. And where I am, you are not able to come’?”

37.verse: On The Last Day Jesus Said, Come To Me. The Crowd Remained Divided Over Him - Now on the last day, the great day of the Feast, Jesus was standing there. And He cried-out, saying, “If anyone is thirsting, let him come to Me and drink.

38.verse: The one believing in Me, just as the Scripture said— Rivers of living water will flow from his belly”.

39.verse: Now He said this concerning the Spirit, Whom the ones having believed in Him were going to receive. For the Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.

40.verse: Then some from the crowd, having heard these words, were saying “This One is truly the Prophet”.

41.verse: Others were saying “This One is the Christ”. But the ones were saying “The Christ is not indeed coming from Galilee, is He?

42.verse: Did not the Scripture say that the Christ comes from the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”

43.verse: So a division took place in the crowd because of Him.

44.verse: And some of them were wanting to seize Him, but no one put his hands on Him.

45.verse: Most of The Jewish Rulers And Pharisees Did Not Believe In Him - Then the officers went to the chief priests and Pharisees. And those ones said to them, “For what reason did you not bring Him?”

46.verse: The officers answered, “Never did a man speak in this manner”.

47.verse: Then the Pharisees responded to them, “You also have not been deceived, have you?

48.verse: Someone from the rulers did not believe in Him, did he, or from the Pharisees?

49.verse: But this crowd not knowing the Law— they are accursed ones”.

50.verse: Nicodemus— the one having come to Him formerly, being one of them— says to them,

51.verse: “Our Law does not judge the person unless it first hears from him, and knows what he is doing, does it ?”

52.verse: They responded and said to him, “You also are not from Galilee, are you? Search and see that a prophet does not arise from Galilee”.

53.verse: And each one went to his house,

1.verse: but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

2.verse: The Pharisees Bring Jesus a Woman Caught In Adultery - Now at dawn, He again arrived in the temple. And all the people were coming to Him. And having sat-down, He was teaching them.

3.verse: And the scribes and the Pharisees bring a woman having been caught in adultery. And having stood her in the middle,

4.verse: they say to Him, “Teacher, this woman has been caught in the-act, while committing-adultery.

5.verse: Now in the Law, Moses commanded us to be stoning such women. What then do You say?”

6.verse: Now they were saying this testing Him, in order that they might have grounds to be accusing Him. But Jesus, having stooped down, was writing in the ground with His finger.

7.verse: But as they were continuing-on asking Him, He straightened-up and said to them, “Let the sinless one among you throw a stone at her first”.

8.verse: And again having stooped-down, He was writing in the ground.

9.verse: And the ones, having heard it, were going out one by one, beginning from the older ones. And He was left-behind alone, and the woman being in the middle.

10.verse: And Jesus, having straightened up, said to her, “Woman, where are they? Did no one condemn you?”

11.verse: And the one said, “No one, Sir”. And Jesus said, “Neither do I condemn you. Go. And from now on, do not be sinning any longer”.

12.verse: I Am The Light of The World, To Which I And My Father Are Testifying - Then Jesus again spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. The one following Me will never walk in the darkness, but will have the light of  life”.

13.verse: So the Pharisees said to Him, “You are testifying about Yourself— Your testimony is not true”.

14.verse: Jesus responded and said to them, “Even if I am testifying about Myself, My testimony is true, because I know from where I came, and where I am going. But you do not know from where I come, or where I am going.

15.verse: You are judging according to the flesh. I am not judging anyone.

16.verse: But even if I am judging, My judgment is true, because I am not alone— but it is I and the Father having sent Me.

17.verse: But even in your Law, it has been written that the testimony of two people is true.

18.verse: I am the One testifying about Myself. And the Father having sent Me is testifying about Me”.

19.verse: So they were saying to Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you knew Me, you would also know My Father”.

20.verse: These words He spoke in the treasury, while teaching in the temple. And no one seized Him, because His hour had not yet come.

21.verse: I Am Going Away. Unless You Believe That I Am The One, You Will Die In Your Sins - Then He said again to them, “I am going away. And you will seek Me. And you will die in your sin. Where I am going, you are not able to come”.

22.verse: So the Jews were saying, “He will not kill Himself, will He— because He says, ‘Where I am going, you are not able to come’?”

23.verse: And He was saying to them, “You are from below, I am from above. You are from this world, I am not from this world.

24.verse: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am the One, you will die in your sins”.

25.verse: I Am What I Have Been Saying I Am From The Beginning - So they were saying to Him, “Who are You?” Jesus said to them, “What thing from the beginning I am indeed telling you!

26.verse: I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you. However, the One having sent Me is true. And what things I heard from Him— these things I am speaking to the world”.

27.verse: They did not know that He was speaking to them about the Father.

28.verse: When You Lift Up The Son of Man, You Will Know I Am The One - Then Jesus said to them, “When you lift-up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am the One, and I am doing nothing from Myself, but I am speaking these things just as the Father taught Me.

29.verse: And the One having sent Me is with Me. He did not leave Me alone, because I am always doing the things pleasing to Him”.

30.verse: While He was speaking these things, many believed in Him.

31.verse: If You Remain In My Word, Then You Are Truly My Disciples And The Truth Will Set You Free - Then Jesus was saying to the Jews having believed Him, “If you remain in My word, you are truly My disciples,

32.verse: and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free”.

33.verse: You Are Slaves of Sin. If The Son Sets You Free, You Will Truly Be Free - They responded to Him, “We are the seed of Abraham, and to no one have we ever been slaves. How is it You say that ‘You will become free’?”

34.verse: Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly, I say to you that everyone doing sin is a slave of sin.

35.verse: Now the slave does not remain in the house forever. The son remains forever.

36.verse: Therefore if the Son sets you free, you will really be free.

37.verse: I know that you are the seed of Abraham. But you are seeking to kill Me, because My word is not advancing in you.

38.verse: I am speaking the things which I have seen with My Father. And you therefore are doing the things which you heard from your father”.

39.verse: You Are Doing The Works of Your Father, Not Abraham - They responded and said to Him, “Our father is Abraham”. Jesus says to them, “If you are children of Abraham, you would be doing the works of Abraham.

40.verse: But now you are seeking to kill Me— a man Who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.

41.verse: You are doing the works of your father”. If God Were Your Father, You Would Be Loving Me. Your Father Is The Devil -So they said to Him, “We have not been born out of sexuality-immorality; we have one father— God”.

42.verse: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would be loving Me, for I came-forth and am-here from God. For I have not even come of Myself, but that One sent Me forth.

43.verse: For what reason are you not understanding My speaking? It is because you are not able to hear My word.

44.verse: You are of your father the devil. And you are wanting to do the desires of your father. That one was a murderer from the beginning, and was not standing in the truth, because there is no truth in him. Whenever he speaks the lie, he speaks from his own things, because he is a liar, and the father of it.

45.verse: And because I am speaking the truth, you are not believing Me.

46.verse: Which of you convicts Me concerning sin? If I am speaking truth, for what reason are you not believing Me?

47.verse: The one being of  God hears the words of God. For this reason you are not hearing— because you are not of God”.

48.verse: I Am Honoring My Father. If You Keep My Word, You Will Never See Death - The Jews responded and said to Him, “Do we not rightly say that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”

49.verse: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon, but I am honoring My Father, and you are dishonoring Me.

50.verse: But I am not seeking My glory. There is the One seeking it, and judging.

51.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you— if anyone keeps My word, he will never see death, ever”.

52.verse: You Do Not Know God, But I Do. And Abraham Was Glad When He Saw My Day - So the Jews said to Him, “Now we have come-to-know that You have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets! And You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word, he will never taste death, ever!’

53.verse: You are not greater than our father Abraham who died, are you? The prophets died also. Whom do You make Yourself ?”

54.verse: Jesus answered, “If I glorify Myself, My glory is nothing. The One glorifying Me is My Father— Whom you say that ‘He is our God’.

55.verse: And you have not come-to-know Him, but I know Him. And if I say that I do not know Him, I will be a liar like you. But I know Him, and I am keeping His word.

56.verse: Abraham your father rejoiced-greatly to see My day. And he saw it, and was glad”.

57.verse: Before Abraham Was, I Am. Hearing This, They Picked Up Stones To Kill Jesus - So the Jews said to Him, “You do not yet have fifty years, and You have seen Abraham?”

58.verse: Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you— before Abraham came-into-being, I am”.

59.verse: Therefore they picked up stones in order that they might throw them at Him. But Jesus was hidden, and went out of the temple.

1.verse: While Passing On, Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind - And while passing on, He saw a man blind from birth.

2.verse: And His disciples asked Him, saying “Rabbi, who sinned— this one or his parents, that he should be born blind?”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “Neither this one sinned nor his parents, but it was in order that the works of God might be made-visible in him.

4.verse: We must be working the works of the One having sent Me while it is day. Night is coming, when no one can work.

5.verse: When I am in the world, I am the light of the world”.

6.verse: Having said these things, He spat on the ground and made mud from the saliva, and smeared its mud on the eyes,

7.verse: and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated “Sent”). So he went away and washed, and came [back] seeing.

8.verse: Then the neighbors, and the ones seeing him formerly— because he was a beggar— were saying “Is not this the one sitting and begging?”

9.verse: Others were saying that “This is he”. Others were saying, “No, but he is like him”. That one was saying that “I am he”.

10.verse: So they were saying to him, “How then were your eyes opened?”

11.verse: That one answered, “The man being called Jesus made mud and smeared it on my eyes, and said to me ‘Go to Siloam and wash’. So having gone away and washed, I received-sight”.

12.verse: And they said to him, “Where is that One?” He says, “I do not know”.

13.verse: The Pharisees Were Divided Over This Sign, Because It Was Done On a Sabbath - They bring him to the Pharisees— the formerly blind one.

14.verse: Now it was a Sabbath on the day Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.

15.verse: Therefore the Pharisees also were asking him again how he received-sight. And the one said to them, “He put mud on my eyes, and I washed, and I see”.

16.verse: Then some of the Pharisees were saying, “This man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath”. But others were saying, “How is a sinful man able to do such signs?” And there was a division among them.

17.verse: So they say to the blind one again, “What do you say about Him, seeing-that He opened your eyes?” And the one said that “He is a prophet”.

18.verse: The Pharisees Question Whether He Was Blind, And Call In The Parents - Then the Jews did not believe concerning him that he was blind and received-sight— until they called the parents of him having received-sight.

19.verse: And they asked them, saying “Is this your son whom you are saying that he was born blind? How then does he see now?”

20.verse: So his parents responded and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind.

21.verse: But how he now sees— we do not know. Or who opened his eyes— we do not know. Ask him. He has a mature-age. He will speak about himself ”.

22.verse: His parents said these things because they were fearing the Jews. For the Jews already had agreed that if anyone confessed Him as the Christ, he should become put-out-of-the-synagogue.

23.verse: For this reason his parents said that “He has a mature-age, question him”.

24.verse: They Don’t Want To Believe Jesus Did It, So They Question The Man Again - Then they called for a second time the man who was blind, and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner”.

25.verse: So that one responded, “Whether He is a sinner, I do not know. I know one thing— that being a blind one, now I see”.

26.verse: So they said to him, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”

27.verse: He answered them, “I told you already and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You also do not want to become His disciples, do you?”

28.verse: And they reviled him and said, “You are a disciple of that One, but we are disciples of Moses.

29.verse: We know that God has spoken to Moses. But we do not know where this One is from”.

30.verse: The man responded and said to them, “Why, in this is the marvel— that you do not know where He is from, and He opened my eyes!

31.verse: We know that God does not hear sinners. But if anyone is a God-fearing one, and is doing His will— He hears this one.

32.verse: It was not ever heard that someone opened the eyes of one having been born blind.

33.verse: If this One were not from God, He would be able to do nothing”.

34.verse: They responded and said to him, “You were born entirely in sins, and you are teaching us?” And they threw him outside.

35.verse: Jesus Tells The Man, I Came So The Blind May See And The Seeing May Become Blind - Jesus heard that they threw him outside, and having found him, said “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”

36.verse: That one responded and said, “Who indeed is He, Sir, in order that I may believe in Him?”

37.verse: Jesus said to him, “You have both seen Him, and that One is the One speaking with you”.

38.verse: And the one said, “Master, I believe”, and prostrated-himself  before Him.

39.verse: And Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment— so that the ones not seeing may be seeing, and the ones seeing may become blind”.

40.verse: You Pharisees Are Thieves, Not Shepherds, So God’s Sheep Do Not Follow You - Some of the Pharisees heard these things— the ones being with him— and said to Him, “We indeed are not blind ones, are we?”

41.verse: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind ones, you would not have sin. But you are saying now that ‘We see’— your sin remains.

1.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, the one not entering into the fold of the sheep through the door, but going-up from-another-place— that one is a thief and a robber.

2.verse: But the One entering through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.verse: The doorkeeper opens to this One. And the sheep hear His voice. And He calls His own sheep by name, and leads them out.

4.verse: When He brings out all His own, He proceeds in front of them. And the sheep are following Him, because they know His voice.

5.verse: But they will never follow a stranger, but will flee from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers”.

6.verse: Jesus spoke this figure-of-speech to them, but those ones did not understand what the things were which He was speaking to them.

7.verse: I Am The Door of The Sheep. All Who Enter Through Me Will Be Saved - Then Jesus said again, “Truly, truly, I say to you that I am the door of  the sheep.

8.verse: All who came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen-to them.

9.verse: I am the door. If anyone enters through Me, he will be saved. And he will go in and go out, and he will find pasture.

10.verse: The thief does not come except that he may steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life, and have abundance.

11.verse: I Am The Good Shepherd. All My Sheep Know Me. I Give My Life For Them - “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays-down His life for the sheep.

12.verse: The one being a hired one and not a shepherd, of whom the sheep are not his own— he sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees, and the wolf snatches them and scatters them,

13.verse: because he is a hired one, and he is not concerned about the sheep.

14.verse: I am the good shepherd. And I know My sheep, and My sheep know Me—

15.verse: just as the Father knows Me, and I know the Father. And I lay-down My life for the sheep.

16.verse: And I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring those also. And they will hear My voice. And they will become one flock, [with] one Shepherd.

17.verse: For this reason the Father loves Me— because I lay down My life so that I may take it up again.

18.verse: No one takes it away from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take it up again. I received this commandment from My Father”.

19.verse: The Pharisees Remain Divided - A division again took place among the Jews because of these words.

20.verse: And many of them were saying, “He has a demon, and He is mad. Why are you listening-to Him?”

21.verse: Others were saying, “These words are not from one being demon-possessed. A demon is not able to open the eyes of blind ones, is he?”

22.verse: During The Festival of Hanukkah, Jesus Says He And The Father Are One - Then the Festival-of-Dedication took place in Jerusalem. It was winter.

23.verse: And Jesus was walking in the temple, in the portico of Solomon.

24.verse: Then the Jews surrounded Him. And they were saying to Him, “How long are You keeping us in suspense? If You are the Christ, tell us with plainness”.

25.verse: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you do not believe. The works which I am doing in the name of My Father— these are testifying about Me.

26.verse: However, you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep.

27.verse: My sheep hear My voice. And I know them, and they follow Me.

28.verse: And I give them eternal life, and they will never perish, ever. And someone will not snatch them out of My hand.

29.verse: What My Father has given to Me is greater than all. And no one is able to snatch them out of the hand of the Father.

30.verse: I and the Father are one”.

31.verse: The Jewish Leaders Want To Kill Jesus For Blasphemy Because He Is Making Himself God - The Jews again carried stones in order that they might stone Him.

32.verse: Jesus responded to them, “I showed you many good works from the Father. For which work of them do you stone Me?”

33.verse: The Jews answered Him, “We do not stone You for a good work, but for blasphemy— even because You, being a human, are making Yourself God”.

34.verse: Jesus Responds: Saying “I Am God’s Son” Is Not Blasphemy If I Am Doing God’s Works - Jesus responded to them, “Has it not been written in your Law that ‘I said, you are gods’?

35.verse: If He called those ones to whom the word of God came gods— and the Scripture cannot be broken—

36.verse: do you say as to the One Whom the Father set-apart and sent-forth into the world that ‘You are blaspheming’ because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?

37.verse: If I am not doing the works of My Father, do not be believing Me.

38.verse: But if I am doing them— even if you do not believe Me, be believing the works, in order that you may come-to-know and be understanding that the Father is in Me, and I in the Father”.

39.verse: Then they were seeking again to seize Him, and He went out of their hand.

40.verse: Jesus Leaves Judea - And He went away again beyond the Jordan, to the place where John was first baptizing. And He was staying there.

41.verse: And many came to Him, and were saying that “John did no sign— but all that John said about this One was true”.

42.verse: And many believed in Him there.

1.verse: Jesus Hears That Lazarus Is Sick - Now there was a certain one being sick— Lazarus, from Bethany, of the village of Mary and Martha, her sister.

2.verse: And it was Mary, the one having anointed the Lord with perfume and having wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.

3.verse: So the sisters sent out a message to Him, saying, “Lord, look— the one whom You love is sick”.

4.verse: And having heard, Jesus said “This sickness is not leading to death, but for the glory of God, in order that the Son of God may be glorified through it”.

5.verse: Jesus Returns To Judea To Raise Lazarus From The Dead - Now Jesus was loving Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

6.verse: So when He heard that he was sick, at that time He remained for two days in which place He was—

7.verse: then after this, says to the disciples, “Let us be going to Judea again”.

8.verse: The disciples say to Him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just-now seeking to stone You, and You are going there again?”

9.verse: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours of the day? If one walks during the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.

10.verse: But if one walks during the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him”.

11.verse: He said these things, and after this He says to them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen-asleep, but I am going in order that I may awaken him”.

12.verse: So the disciples said to Him, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will be restored”.

13.verse: Now Jesus had spoken concerning his death, but those ones thought that He was speaking concerning the sleep of slumber.

14.verse: So at-that-time Jesus said to them with plainness, “Lazarus died.

15.verse: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us be going to him”.

16.verse: Then Thomas, the one being called Didymus, said to his fellow-disciples, “Let us indeed be going, so that we may die with Him”.

17.verse: Jesus Says, I Am The Resurrection And The Life. The One Believing In Me Will Live - So having come, Jesus found him already having four days in the tomb.

18.verse: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stades away.

19.verse: And many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary in order that they might console them concerning their brother.

20.verse: So Martha, when she heard that Jesus was coming, met Him. But Mary was sitting in the house.

21.verse: Then Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.

22.verse: But even now I know that whatever You ask God, God will give You”.

23.verse: Jesus says to her, “Your brother will rise-up”.

24.verse: Martha says to Him, “I know that he will rise-up in the resurrection at the last day”.

25.verse: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one believing in Me— even though he dies, he will live.

26.verse: And everyone living and believing in Me will never die, ever. Do you believe this?”

27.verse: She says to Him, “Yes, Lord. I have believed that You are the Christ, the Son of God, the One coming into the world”.

28.verse: And having said this, she went away and called Mary her sister secretly, having said, “The Teacher is here and is calling you”.

29.verse: And that one, when she heard, arose quickly and was going to Him.

30.verse: Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha met Him.

31.verse: So the Jews— the ones being with her in the house and consoling her—having seen that Mary stood up quickly and went out, followed her, having supposed that she was going to the tomb in order that she might weep there.

32.verse: Then Mary— when she came where Jesus was, having seen Him— fell at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died”.

33.verse: Then Jesus— when He saw her weeping, and the Jews having come with her weeping— was deeply-moved in His spirit, and troubled Himself.

34.verse: And He said, “Where have you laid him?” They say to Him, “Lord, come and see”.

36.verse: So the Jews were saying, “Look— how He was loving him!”

37.verse: And some of them said, “Was not this One— the One having opened the eyes of the blind one— able to cause that this one also should not die?”

38.verse: Jesus Calls Lazarus Out of The Tomb. Many Believe In Him - Then Jesus, again being deeply-moved in Himself, comes to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone was lying upon it.

39.verse: Jesus says, “Take away the stone”. Martha, the sister of the one having come-to-an-end, says to Him, “Lord, he already stinks, for it is the fourth-day”.

40.verse: Jesus says to her, “Did I not say to you that if you believe, you will see the glory of God?”

41.verse: So they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted His eyes upward, and said, “Father, I thank You that You heard Me.

42.verse: Now I knew that You always hear Me. But I said this for the sake of the crowd having stood around— in order that they may believe that You sent Me forth”.

43.verse: And having said these things, He shouted with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come outside!”

44.verse: The one having died came out, having been bound as to the feet and the hands with grave-cloths. And his face had been bound-around with a face-cloth. Jesus says to them, “Unbind him, and allow him to go”.

45.verse: Therefore many of the Jews— the ones having come to Mary, and having seen the things which He did— believed in Him.

46.verse: Some Told The Pharisees. Caiaphas Prophesies, Better For One To Die For The People - But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them the things which Jesus did.

47.verse: So the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered together a council. And they were saying, “What are we doing? Because this man is doing many signs!

48.verse: If we tolerate Him in this manner, everyone will believe in Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation”.

49.verse: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being the high priest of that year, said to them, “You do not know anything—

50.verse: nor do you consider that it is better for you that one Man die for the people, and the whole nation not perish”.

51.verse: Now he did not say this from himself, but being the high priest of that year, he prophesied that Jesus was going to die for the nation.

52.verse: And not for the nation only, but in order that He might also gather together into one the children of God having been scattered [in the world].

53.verse: Therefore from that day, they planned to kill Him.

54.verse: Jesus Withdraws From The Public - Therefore Jesus was no longer walking in public among the Jews, but went away from there to the region near the wilderness, to a city being called Ephraim. And He stayed there with the disciples.

55.verse: At The Passover, Everyone Was Looking For Jesus - Now the Passover [Feast] of the Jews was near. And many went up to Jerusalem from the country before the Passover [Feast], in order that they might purify themselves.

56.verse: So they were seeking Jesus, and saying, standing with one another in the temple, “What seems right to you— that He will by no means come to the Feast?”

57.verse: And the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commands that if anyone came-to-know where He was, he should disclose it— so that they might seize Him.

1.verse: In Bethany At a Dinner For Jesus And Lazarus, Mary Anoints Jesus - Therefore Jesus, six days before the Passover [Feast], came to Bethany where Lazarus was, the one whom Jesus raised from the dead.

2.verse: So they made a dinner for Him there. And Martha was serving. And Lazarus was one of the ones reclining-back [to eat] with Him.

3.verse: Then Mary, having taken a pound of very-valuable genuine nard perfume, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled from the aroma of the perfume.

4.verse: But Judas the Iscariot— one of His disciples, the one going to hand Him over— says,

5.verse: “For what reason was this perfume not sold for three-hundred denarii and given to poor ones?”

6.verse: Now he said this, not because he was concerned about the poor, but because he was a thief. And having the money-box, he was carrying the things being put there.

7.verse: So Jesus said, “Leave her alone. It was in order that she might keep it for the day of My preparation-for-burial.

8.verse: For you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have Me”.

9.verse: Then the large crowd of the Jews came-to-know that He was there. And they came— not because of Jesus only, but in order that they might also see Lazarus, whom He raised from the dead.

10.verse: And the chief priests planned to kill Lazarus also,

11.verse: because many of the Jews were going-away and were believing in Jesus because of him.

12.verse: Jesus The King Enters Jerusalem On a Donkey, As Predicted By Zechariah - On the next day the large crowd— the one having come to the Feast— having heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

13.verse: took the branches of palm-trees and came out to meet Him. And they were shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is the One coming in the name of the Lord, even the King of Israel”.

14.verse: And Jesus, having found a young-donkey, sat on it, just as it has been written [in Zech 9:9]:

15.verse: “Do not be fearing, daughter of Zion. Behold— your King is coming, sitting on a colt of a donkey”.

16.verse: His disciples did not understand these things at first. But when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things had been written for Him, and that they did these things to Him.

17.verse: Then the crowd was testifying— the one being with Him when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead.

18.verse: For this reason also the crowd met Him— because they heard that He had done this sign.

19.verse: Then the Pharisees said to themselves, “You see that you are profiting nothing! Look— the world went after Him!”

20.verse: Jesus Says The Hour For Which He Came Has Come. A Seed Must Die To Bear Fruit - Now some of the ones going up in order that they might worship at the Feast were Greeks.

21.verse: So these ones came to Philip, the one from Bethsaida of Galilee, and were asking him, saying, “Sir, we wish to see Jesus”.

22.verse: Philip comes and tells Andrew. Andrew and Philip come, and they tell Jesus.

23.verse: And Jesus responds to them, saying, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

24.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, unless the seed of wheat having fallen to the earth dies, it remains alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.

25.verse: The one loving his life loses it, and the one hating his life in this world will keep it for eternal life.

26.verse: If anyone serves Me, let him be following Me. And where I am, there also My servant will be. If anyone serves Me, the Father will honor him.

27.verse: Now My soul has been troubled. And what should I say— ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? But for this reason I came to this hour!

28.verse: Father, glorify Your name!” Now Is The Judgment of This World. If I Am Lifted Up, I Will Draw All People To Myself -Then a voice came from heaven: “I both glorified it, and will again glorify it”.

29.verse: Then the crowd, the one standing there and having heard, was saying that thunder had taken place. Others were saying, “An angel has spoken to Him”.

30.verse: Jesus responded and said, “This voice has taken place not for My sake, but for your sakes.

31.verse: Now is the judgment of this world! Now the ruler of this world will be cast out!

32.verse: And if I am lifted-up from the earth, I will draw all people to Myself ”.

33.verse: Now He was saying this signifying by what-kind-of death He was going to die.

34.verse: Believe In The Light While You Have The Light, That You May Become Sons of Light - Then the crowd responded to Him, “We heard from the Law that the Christ remains forever. How indeed do You say that ‘The Son of Man must be lifted-up’? Who is this Son of Man?”

35.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “The Light is among you for a short time longer. Be walking while you have the Light, in order that darkness may not overtake you. Indeed the one walking in the darkness does not know where he is going.

36.verse: While you have the Light, be believing in the Light, in order that you may become sons of Light”. Jesus spoke these things, and having gone away, was hidden from them.

37.verse: Isaiah Is Fulfilled: God Blinded Their Eyes And Hardened Their Hearts - Now He having done so-many signs in front of them— they were not believing in Him,

38.verse: in order that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled which he spoke [in Isa 53:1]: “Lord, who believed our report? And to whom was the arm of the Lord revealed?”

39.verse: For this reason they were not able to believe: because again Isaiah said [in Isa 6:10]

40.verse: “He has blinded their eyes, and He hardened their heart, in order that they might not see with their eyes, and comprehend in their heart, and be turned, and I shall heal them”.

41.verse: Isaiah said these things because he saw His glory and spoke about Him.

42.verse: Yet indeed, even many of the rulers believed in Him. But because of the Pharisees, they were not confessing it in order that they might not become put-out-of-the-synagogue.

43.verse: For they loved the glory of people more than the glory of God.

44.verse: I Came To Save The World, And I Spoke The Father’s Words. My Words Are Eternal Life - And Jesus cried-out and said “The one believing in Me is not believing in Me, but in the One having sent Me.

45.verse: And the one seeing Me is seeing the One having sent Me.

46.verse: I have come into the world as a light, so that everyone believing in Me should not remain in the darkness.

47.verse: And if anyone hears My words and does not keep them, I do not judge him. For I did not come in order that I might judge the world, but in order that I might save the world.

48.verse: The one rejecting Me and not receiving My words has that which judges him— the word which I spoke, that will judge him at the last day.

49.verse: Because I did not speak out of Myself, but the Father having sent Me— He has given Me a commandment as to what I should say and what I should speak.

50.verse: And I know that His commandment is eternal life. Therefore the things which I speak— just as the Father has told Me, so I speak”.

1.verse: Jesus Loves His Own To The End - Now before the Feast of the Passover, Jesus— knowing that His hour came for Him to pass from this world to the Father— having loved His own ones in the world, loved them to the end.

2.verse: At Dinner, Jesus Washes The Feet of The Twelve As an Example For Them To Follow - And dinner taking-place, the devil having already put into his heart that Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, should hand Him over—

3.verse: Jesus, knowing that the Father gave Him all things into His hands, and that He came forth from God and is going to God,

4.verse: arises from the dinner and lays-down His [outer] garments. And having taken a towel, He tied it around Himself.

5.verse: Then He puts water into the wash-basin. And He began to wash the feet of the disciples, and to wipe them with the towel which had been tied-around Himself.

6.verse: Then He comes to Simon Peter. He says to Him, “Lord, do You wash my feet?”

7.verse: Jesus responded and said to him, “You do not know what I am doing now, but you will understand after these things”.

8.verse: Peter says to Him, “You will never wash my feet, ever!” Jesus responded to him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with Me”.
