9.verse: Simon Peter says to Him, “Lord, wash not my feet only, but also the hands and the head!”

10.verse: Jesus says to him, “The one having bathed has no need except to wash his feet, but is entirely clean. And you are clean— but not all of you”.

11.verse: For He knew the one handing Him over. For this reason He said that “You are not all clean”.

12.verse: Then when He washed their feet, and took His garments, and fell back again [to eat], He said to them, “Do you understand what I have done for you?

13.verse: You call Me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord’— and you speak rightly, for I am.

14.verse: Therefore if I, the Lord and the Teacher, washed your feet, you also ought to be washing the feet of one another.

15.verse: For I gave you an example, in order that you also should be doing just as I did for you.

16.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, a slave is not greater than his master, nor is a messenger greater than the one having sent him.

17.verse: If you know these things, you are blessed if you are doing them.

18.verse: I am not speaking with-reference-to all of you. I know the ones whom I chose. But it is taking place in order that the Scripture [in Ps 41:9] might be fulfilled: ‘The one eating My bread lifted-up his heel against Me’.

19.verse: From now on, I am telling you ahead of it taking place, in order that when it takes place you may believe that I am the One.

20.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, the one receiving whomever I send is receiving Me. And the one receiving Me is receiving the One having sent Me”.

21.verse: Judas Is Identified As The Betrayer, And Leaves The Room - Having said these things, Jesus was troubled in His spirit. And He testified and said “Truly, truly, I say to you that one of you will hand Me over”.

22.verse: The disciples were looking at one another, being perplexed about whom He was speaking.

23.verse: One of His disciples was reclining-back at the bosom of Jesus— the one whom Jesus was loving.

24.verse: So Simon Peter nods to this one to inquire as to who it might be about whom He is speaking.

25.verse: So that one, having leaned back thus on the chest of Jesus, says to Him, “Lord, who is it?”

26.verse: Jesus answers, “It is that one for whom I will dip the piece-of-bread and give it to him”. Then having dipped the piece-of-bread, He takes and gives it to Judas, son of Simon Iscariot.

27.verse: And after the piece-of-bread, at that time Satan entered into that one. Then Jesus says to him, “What you are doing, do quicker”.

28.verse: Now none of the ones reclining-back [to eat] understood this— for what purpose He said it to him.

29.verse: For some were thinking, since Judas had the money-box, that Jesus was telling him, “Buy the things of which we have a need for the Feast”, or that he should give something to the poor.

30.verse: So having received the piece-of-bread, that one went out immediately. And it was night.

31.verse: Then Jesus Says, Now God Was Glorified In Me. And He Will Yet Glorify Me - Then when he went out, Jesus says, “Now the Son of Man was glorified, and God was glorified in Him.

32.verse: If God was glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself— and will glorify Him immediately.

33.verse: Where I Am Going You Cannot Come. Love One Another As I Have Loved You - “Little-children, I am with you a little longer. You will seek Me, and just as I told the Jews that where I am going, you are not able to come, I also tell you now.

34.verse: I am giving you a new commandment— that you be loving one another; just as I loved you, that you also be loving one another.

35.verse: By this everyone will know that you are disciples to Me: if you are having love in-the-case-of  one another”.

36.verse: Peter Asks Why He Can’t Come. You Will Follow Later, But Deny Me Tonight - Simon Peter says to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered him, “Where I am going, you are not able to follow Me now. But you will follow later”.

37.verse: Peter says to Him, “Lord, for what reason am I not able to follow You right-now? I will lay-down my life for You”.

38.verse: Jesus responds, “Will you lay-down your life for Me? Truly, truly, I say to you, a rooster will by no means crow until which time you deny Me three-times!

1.verse: I Go To Prepare a Place For You So That You May Be With Me. And You Know The Way - “Do not let your heart be troubled. Be believing in God. Be believing also in Me.

2.verse: There are many places-to-stay in the house of My Father— otherwise, I would have told you.

3.verse: For I am going to prepare a place for you. And if I go and prepare a place for you, I am coming back. And I will take you to Myself— in order that where I am, you also may be.

4.verse: And you know the way where I am going”.

5.verse: I Am The Way, The Truth, And The Life. And You Have Seen The Father - Thomas says to Him, “Lord, we do not know where You are going. How are we able to know the way?”

6.verse: Jesus says to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.

7.verse: If you have known Me, you will know My Father also. And from now on, you know Him, and you have seen Him”.

8.verse: He Who Has Seen Me Has Seen The Father - Philip says to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it is enough for us”.

9.verse: Jesus says to him, “Am I with you all for so long a time, and you have not known Me, Philip?— the one having seen Me has seen the Father. How is it you say, ‘Show us the Father’?

10.verse: Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father is in Me? I am not speaking the words which I am saying to you from Myself, but the Father abiding in Me is doing His works.

11.verse: Be believing Me— that I am in the Father and the Father is in Me. Otherwise, be believing because of the works themselves.

12.verse: You Will Do Greater Works Than I. The Father Will Send You The Helper - “Truly, truly, I say to you— the one believing in Me, that one also will do the works which I am doing. And he will do greater works than these, because I am going to the Father.

13.verse: And whatever thing you ask in My name, this I will do, in order that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

14.verse: If you ask Me anything in My name, I will do it.

15.verse: If you love Me, you will keep My commandments.

16.verse: And I will request the Father, and He will give you another Helper to be with you forever—

17.verse: the Spirit of truth, Whom the world is not able to receive because it does not see nor know Him. You know Him because He abides with you, and will be in you.

18.verse: You Will See Me Again. And I Will Reveal Myself To Those Who Love Me - “I will not leave you as orphans. I am going to come to you.

19.verse: A little longer, and the world is no longer going to see Me, but you are going to see Me. Because I live, you also will live.

20.verse: On that day, you will know that I am in My Father, and you are in Me, and I am in you.

21.verse: The one having My commandments and keeping them— that one is the one loving Me. And the one loving Me will be loved by My Father. And I will love him and reveal Myself to him”.

22.verse: The Father And I Will Abide With Those Who Love Me And Keep My Word - Judas (not the Iscariot) says to Him, “Lord, what indeed has taken place that You are going to reveal Yourself to us and not to the world?”

23.verse: Jesus responded and said to him, “If anyone loves Me, he will keep My word. And My Father will love him. And We will come to him. And We will make a place-to-stay with him.

24.verse: The one not loving Me does not keep My words. And the word which you are hearing is not Mine, but the Father’s having sent Me.

25.verse: The Holy Spirit Whom The Father Will Send In My Name Will Teach You All Things - “I have spoken these things to you while staying with you.

26.verse: But the Helper— the Holy Spirit, Whom the Father will send in My name— that One will teach you all things, and remind you of everything which I said to you.

27.verse: I Leave You My Peace. Do Not Be Troubled. I Am Returning To The Father - “I leave you peace. I give you My peace. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your heart be troubled, nor let it be afraid.

28.verse: You heard that I said to you, ‘I am going, and I am coming to you’. If you were loving Me, you would have rejoiced that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than Me.

29.verse: And now I have told you before it takes place, in order that when it takes place, you may believe.

30.verse: I Love The Father And Am Doing Just What He Commanded Me To Do - “I will no longer speak many things with you, for the ruler of the world is coming. And he does not have anything in Me,

31.verse: but it is taking place in order that the world may know that I love the Father, and that just as the Father commanded Me, so I am doing. I Am The Vine. Abide In Me And Bear Much Fruit. Abide In My Love -“Arise, let us be going from here.

1.verse: I am the true grapevine, and My Father is the farmer.

2.verse: Every branch in Me not bearing fruit— He takes it away. And every branch bearing fruit— He cleans it in order that it may bear more fruit.

3.verse: You are already clean, because of the word which I have spoken to you.

4.verse: Abide in Me, and I in you. Just as the branch is not able to bear fruit from itself unless it is abiding in the grapevine, so neither are you able unless you are abiding in Me.

5.verse: I am the grapevine, you are the branches. The one abiding in Me and I in him— this one bears much fruit. Because apart from Me, you can do nothing.

6.verse: If anyone is not abiding in Me— he was thrown outside like the branch, and was dried-up. And they gather them together, and throw them into the fire. And they are burned.

7.verse: If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, ask whatever you want, and it will be done for you.

8.verse: By this My Father is glorified— that you be bearing much fruit, and be disciples to Me.

9.verse: Just as the Father loved Me, I also loved you. Abide in My love.

10.verse: If you keep My commandments, you will abide in My love— just as I have kept the commandments of My Father and am abiding in His love.

11.verse: You Are My Friends. I Chose You And Appointed You To Bear Much Fruit - “I have spoken these things to you in order that My joy may be in you, and your joy may be made full.

12.verse: This is My commandment: that you be loving one another just as I loved you.

13.verse: No one has greater love than this: that one lay-down his life for his friends.

14.verse: You are My friends if you are doing the things which I command you.

15.verse: I no longer call you slaves, because the slave does not know what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, because I made-known to you everything which I heard from My Father.

16.verse: You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you, in order that you may go and bear fruit and your fruit may remain, in order that He may give you whatever thing you ask the Father in My name.

17.verse: I am commanding these things to you so-that you will love one another.

18.verse: The World Will Hate You As It Hated Me, Because You Will Be Testifying of Me - “If the world hates you, you know that it has hated Me before you.

19.verse: If you were of the world, the world would be loving its own. But because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world— for this reason the world hates you.

20.verse: Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A slave is not greater than his master’. If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will also keep yours.

21.verse: But they will do all these things to you because of My name, because they do not know the One having sent Me.

22.verse: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be having sin. But now they do not have an excuse for their sin.

23.verse: The one hating Me is also hating My Father.

24.verse: If I had not done among them the works which no other one did, they would not be having sin. But now they have both seen and have hated both Me and My Father.

25.verse: But it has taken place in order that the word having been written in their Law [in Ps 69:4] might be fulfilled— that ‘They hated Me without-a-reason’.

26.verse: When the Helper comes Whom I will send to you from the Father— the Spirit of truth, Who proceeds from the Father— that One will testify about Me.

27.verse: And you also are going to be testifying, because you are [the ones] with Me from the beginning.

1.verse: I Have Told You In Advance So That You May Not Fall - “I have spoken these things to you in order that you may not be caused-to-fall.

2.verse: They will make you put-out-of-the-synagogue ones. Indeed, an hour is coming for everyone having killed you to think that he is offering service to God.

3.verse: And they will do these things because they did not know the Father nor Me.

4.verse: But I have spoken these things to you so that when their hour comes, you may remember that I told you of them. It Is Better That I Go Away, For I Will Send You The Helper To Convict The World -“Now I did not say these things to you from the beginning, because I was with you.

5.verse: But now I am going to the One having sent Me. And none of you is asking Me, ‘Where are You going?’,

6.verse: but grief has filled your heart because I have spoken these things to you.

7.verse: But I tell you the truth— it is better for you that I go away. For if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you. But if I go, I will send Him to you.

8.verse: And having come, that One will convict the world concerning sin, and concerning righteousness, and concerning judgment—

9.verse: concerning sin, because they are not believing in Me;

10.verse: and concerning righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you are no longer going to see Me;

11.verse: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.

12.verse: When The Helper Comes, He Will Guide You Into All Truth - “I still have many things to say to you, but you are not able to bear them now.

13.verse: But when that One, the Spirit of truth, comes— He will guide you in all the truth. For He will not speak from Himself, but He will speak whatever He will hear. And He will declare to you the things coming.

14.verse: That One will glorify Me, because He will take from what is Mine and declare it to you.

15.verse: All that the Father has is Mine. For this reason I said that He takes from what is Mine and will declare it to you.

16.verse: A Little While Longer And I Will Be Gone. A Little While Longer And You Will See Me - “A little while and you are no-longer going to see Me. And again a little while, and you will see Me”.

17.verse: Then some of His disciples said to one another, “What is this which He is saying to us— ‘A little while, and you are not going to see Me. And again a little while, and you will see Me’. And— ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”

18.verse: Then they were saying, “What is this which He is saying— ‘A little while’? We do not know what He is speaking about.

19.verse: You Will Weep, Then You Will Rejoice When I See You Again - Jesus knew that they were wanting to question Him, and He said to them, “Are you seeking with one another concerning this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you are not going to see Me. And again a little while, and you will see Me’?

20.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be grieved, but your grief will become joy.

21.verse: The woman has grief when she gives-birth, because her hour came. But when she bears the child, she no longer remembers the affliction because of the joy that a person was born into the world.

22.verse: You then also now have grief— but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice. And no one is going to take away your joy from you.

23.verse: And in that day you will not question Me as to anything. Truly, truly, I say to you, if you ask the Father anything in My name, He will give it to you.

24.verse: Until now you did not ask anything in My name. Be asking and you will receive, in order that your joy may be full.

25.verse: Then I Will Speak To You Plainly About The Father - “I have spoken these things to you in figures-of-speech. An hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figures-of-speech, but I will tell you about the Father with plainness.

26.verse: In that day you will ask in My name. And I am not saying to you that I will request the Father on your behalf.

27.verse: For the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and have believed that I came forth from God.

28.verse: I came forth from the Father, and I have come into the world. Again, I am leaving the world and going to the Father”.

29.verse: But Soon You Will Be Scattered - His disciples say, “Look— now You are speaking with plainness, and You are speaking no figure-of-speech.

30.verse: Now we know that You know all things, and You have no need that anyone question You. By this we believe that You came forth from God”.

31.verse: Jesus responded to them, “Now you believe!

32.verse: Behold, an hour is coming, and has come, for you to be scattered— each to his own things— and leave Me alone. And-yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.

33.verse: Take Courage, I Have Overcome The World - “I have spoken these things to you in order that you may have peace in Me. You have affliction in the world, but take-courage— I have overcome the world”.

1.verse: Jesus Prays: Father, Glorify Your Son - Jesus spoke these things, and having lifted-up His eyes to heaven, said, “Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, so that the Son may glorify You—

2.verse: just as You gave Him authority over all flesh in order that as to all that You have given Him, He may give eternal life to them.

3.verse: And this is eternal life: that they may be knowing You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ Whom You sent-forth.

4.verse: I glorified You on the earth, having accomplished the work which You have given to Me that I should do.

5.verse: And now Father, You glorify Me with Yourself with the glory which I was having with You before the world was.

6.verse: I Have Revealed Your Name To The Men You Gave Me. Keep Them In Your Name - “I revealed Your name to the men whom You gave to Me out of the world. They were Yours, and You gave them to Me. And they have kept Your word.

7.verse: They have now come-to-know that all things that You have given to Me are from You—

8.verse: because I have given them the words which You gave to Me, and they received them, and truly understood that I came forth from You, and believed that You sent Me forth.

9.verse: I am praying for them. I am not praying for the world, but for the ones whom You have given to Me— because they are Yours;

10.verse: indeed all My things are Yours, and Yours, Mine. And I have been glorified in them.

11.verse: And I am no longer in the world, and they are in the world, and I am coming to You. Holy Father, keep them in Your name which You have given to Me, in order that they may be one, just as We are.

12.verse: When I was with them, I was keeping them in Your name which You have given to Me. And I guarded them, and none of them perished— except the son of  destruction, in order that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

13.verse: But now I am coming to You. And I am speaking these things in the world so that they may have My joy made-full in themselves.

14.verse: I Have Given Them Your Word. Set Them Apart In The Truth, Which Is Your Word - “I have given them Your word, and the world hated them— because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.

15.verse: I am not praying that You take them out of the world, but that You keep them from the evil one.

16.verse: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world—

17.verse: set them apart in the truth. Your word is truth.

18.verse: Just as You sent Me forth into the world, I also sent them forth into the world.

19.verse: And I am setting apart Myself for them, in order that they may also be set apart in truth.

20.verse: May These And The Ones Believing Through Them All Be One - “And I am not praying for these ones only, but also for the ones believing in Me through their word,

21.verse: that they may all be one— just as You, Father, are in Me and I am in You, that they also may be in Us— in order that the world may be believing that You sent Me forth.

22.verse: And I have given them the glory which You have given to Me in order that they may be one just as We are one,

23.verse: I in them and You in Me; in order that they may be perfected into one— in order that the world may be knowing that You sent Me forth, and loved them just as You loved Me.

24.verse: Father, I Want Them To Be With Me And See The Glory You Have Given Me - “Father, as to what You have given to Me, I desire that those ones also may be with Me where I am, in order that they may be seeing My glory which You have given to Me because You loved Me before the foundation of the world.

25.verse: Father, I Made You Known To Them In Order That Your Love May Be In Them - “Righteous Father, indeed the world did not know You— but I knew You. And these ones knew that You sent Me forth.

26.verse: And I made Your name known to them, and will make it known, in order that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I may be in them”.

1.verse: Jesus Is Handed Over To The Authorities - Having said these things, Jesus went-out with His disciples to the other side of the ravine of Kidron where there was a garden, into which He entered, He and His disciples.

2.verse: Now Judas, the one handing Him over, also knew the place, because Jesus often was gathered there with His disciples.

3.verse: So Judas— having received the [Roman] cohort, and officers from the chief priests and from the Pharisees— comes there with lanterns and torches and weapons.

4.verse: Then Jesus, knowing all the things coming upon Him, went forth. And He says to them, “Whom are you seeking?”

5.verse: They answered Him, “Jesus the Nazarene”. He says to them, “I am He”. Now Judas, the one handing Him over, was also standing there with them.

6.verse: So when He said to them, “I am He”, they went back, and fell on the ground.

7.verse: Then He again asked them, “Whom are you seeking?” And the ones said, “Jesus the Nazarene”.

8.verse: Jesus responded, “I told you that I am He. If then you are seeking Me, permit these ones to go”—

9.verse: in order that the word which He spoke might be fulfilled, that “The ones whom You have given Me— I did not lose any of them”.

10.verse: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and hit the slave of the high priest, and cut-off his right ear. And the name for the slave was Malchus.

11.verse: Then Jesus said to Peter, “Put the sword into the sheath. The cup which the Father has given Me— shall not I drink it?”

12.verse: Jesus Stands Before Annas And Caiaphas - Then the [Roman] cohort and its commander, and the officers of the Jews, arrested Jesus, and bound Him.

13.verse: And they led Him to Annas first. For he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was the high priest of that year.

14.verse: And Caiaphas was the one having counseled the Jews that it was better that one Man die for the people.

15.verse: Peter Denies Jesus - Now Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. And that disciple was known to the high priest, and he entered with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.

16.verse: But Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, the one known by the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper, and brought in Peter.

17.verse: Then the doorkeeper servant-girl says to Peter, “You are not also one of the disciples of this man, are you?” That one says, “I am not”.

18.verse: And the slaves and the officers, having made a charcoal-fire because it was cold, were standing there and warming themselves. And Peter was also with them, standing there and warming himself.

19.verse: Jesus Says To Annas, Question Those Who Heard Me. He Is Led Out to Caiaphas - So the high priest questioned Jesus about His disciples, and about His teaching.

20.verse: Jesus answered him, “I have spoken in public to the world. I always taught at synagogue, and in the temple, where all the Jews come together. And I spoke nothing in secret.

21.verse: Why are you questioning Me? Question the ones having heard what I spoke to them. Look, these ones know the things which I said”.

22.verse: And He having said these things, one of the officers standing near gave Jesus a slap, having said, “In this manner do you answer the high priest?”

23.verse: Jesus answered him, “If I spoke wrongly, testify about the thing wrong. But if I spoke rightly, why do you beat Me?”

24.verse: Then Annas sent Him forth, having been bound, to Caiaphas the high priest.

25.verse: Peter Denies Jesus a Second And Third Time - And Simon Peter is standing there and warming himself. So they said to him, “You are not also one of His disciples, are you?” That one denied it and said, “I am not”.

26.verse: One of the slaves of the high priest, being a relative of the one of whom Peter cut-off the ear, says, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”

27.verse: Then again Peter denied it. And immediately a rooster crowed.

28.verse: Jesus Stands Before Pilate - Then they lead Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium. And it was early-morning. And they themselves did not enter into the Praetorium in order that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover [Feast].

29.verse: The Jewish Rulers Tell Pilate They Want Jesus Executed - So Pilate went outside to them. And he says, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”

30.verse: They responded and said to him, “If this One were not doing wrong, we would not have handed Him over to you”.

31.verse: So Pilate said to them, “You take Him and judge Him according to your Law”. The Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to execute anyone”—

32.verse: in order that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke signifying by what kind of death He was going to die.

33.verse: Jesus Says To Pilate, My Kingdom Is Not of This World - So Pilate entered again into the Praetorium, and called Jesus. And he said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”

34.verse: Jesus answered, “Are you saying this from yourself, or did others tell you about Me?”

35.verse: Pilate answered, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your nation and the chief priests handed You over to me. What did You do?”

36.verse: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, My servants would be fighting in order that I might not be handed-over to the Jews. But as-it-is, My kingdom is not from here”.

37.verse: Therefore Pilate said to Him, “So-then You are a king?” Jesus answered, “You are saying that I am a king. I have been born for this. And I have come into the world for this: that I might testify to the truth. Everyone being of the truth hears My voice”.

38.verse: Pilate says to Him, “What is truth?” Pilate Finds No Charge Against Jesus, But Has Him Whipped -And having said this, he again went out to the Jews. And he says to them, “I find no charge in Him.

39.verse: But it is a custom for you that I release one prisoner for you at the Passover [Feast]. So do you wish me to release the King of the Jews for you?”

40.verse: Then they shouted back, saying, “Not this One, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.

1.verse: So at that time Pilate took Jesus and whipped Him.

2.verse: And the soldiers, having woven a crown out of thorns, put it on His head. And they clothed Him with a purple garment.

3.verse: And they were coming to Him and saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they were giving Him slaps.

4.verse: The Jews Shout, Crucify Him, Because He Made Himself To Be God’s Son! - And Pilate again went outside. And he says to them, “Look— I am bringing Him outside to you in order that you may know that I find no charge in Him”.

5.verse: Then Jesus came outside, wearing the crown made-of-thorns and the purple garment. And he says to them, “Behold, the man!”

6.verse: Then when they saw Him, the chief priests and the officers shouted, saying, “Crucify, crucify!” Pilate says to them, “You take Him and crucify Him, for I do not find a charge in Him”.

7.verse: The Jews responded to him, “We have a law. And according to the law He ought to die, because He made Himself to be God’s Son”.

8.verse: Pilate Asks Jesus, Where Are You From? Jesus Does Not Answer - Then when Pilate heard this statement, he became more afraid.

9.verse: And he entered into the Praetorium again. And he says to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus did not give him an answer.

10.verse: So Pilate says to Him, “You do not speak to me? Do You not know that I have authority to release You, and I have authority to crucify You?”

11.verse: Jesus answered him, “You would not have any authority against Me unless it had been given to you from above. For this reason the one having handed Me over to you has a greater sin”.

12.verse: Pilate Tries To Release Jesus, But The Jewish Leaders Stop Him - From this time, Pilate was seeking to release Him, but the Jews shouted saying, “If you release this One, you are not a friend of Caesar. Everyone making himself the king is speaking-against Caesar”.

13.verse: Pilate Hesitates Again, But Condemns Jesus - Therefore Pilate, having heard these words, brought Jesus outside, and sat on a judgment-seat in a place being called ‘The Pavement’ (but in Hebrew, ‘Gabbatha’).

14.verse: Now it was Preparation day of the Passover [Feast]. The hour was about the sixth. And he says to the Jews, “Look— your King!”

15.verse: Then those ones shouted, “Take Him away, take Him away, crucify Him!” Pilate says to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We do not have a king except Caesar”.

16.verse: So at that time he handed Him over to them in order that He might be crucified. The King of The Jews Is Crucified -So they took Jesus.

17.verse: And bearing the cross for Himself, He went out to the place being called “The Place of a Skull” (which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha”),

18.verse: where they crucified Him and two others with Him— on this side and on this side, and Jesus in the middle.

19.verse: And Pilate also wrote a title and put it on the cross. And it had been written, “Jesus the Nazarene, the King of the Jews”.

20.verse: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city. And it had been written in Hebrew, Latin, Greek.

21.verse: So the chief priests of the Jews were saying to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews’, but that that One said, ‘I am King of the Jews’”.

22.verse: Pilate responded, “What I have written, I have written”.

23.verse: The Soldiers Take His Garments, Fulfilling Psalm 22 - Then the soldiers, when they crucified Jesus, took His garments and made four parts— a part for each soldier— and the tunic. Now the tunic was seamless, woven from the top through the whole.

24.verse: So they said to one another, “Let us not tear it, but let us cast-lots for it to decide whose it will be”— in order that the Scripture [in Ps 22:18] might be fulfilled, the one saying, “They divided My garments among themselves, and they cast a lot for My clothing”. So indeed, the soldiers did these things.

25.verse: John Takes Mary Into His Household - Now His mother, and the sister of His mother, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary the Magdalene, were standing beside the cross of Jesus.

26.verse: So Jesus, having seen His mother and the disciple whom He was loving standing near, says to His mother, “Woman, look— your son!”

27.verse: Then He says to the disciple, “Look— your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own things.

28.verse: Jesus Dies - After this, Jesus— knowing that all things have already been finished, in order that the Scripture [in Ps 69:21] might be accomplished— says, “I am thirsty”.

29.verse: A jar full of sour-wine was setting there. So having put a sponge full of the sour wine on a hyssop branch, they brought it to His mouth.

30.verse: Then when He received the sour wine, Jesus said, “It has been finished!” And having bowed His head, He gave-over His spirit.

31.verse: Jesus Is Pierced With a Spear, But a Bone Is Not Broken, Fulfilling The Prophecies - Then the Jews— because it was Preparation day, in order that the bodies might not remain on the cross during the Sabbath (for the day of that Sabbath was a great day)— asked Pilate that their legs be broken, and they be taken away.

32.verse: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first one, and of the other one having been crucified-with Him.

33.verse: But having come to Jesus, when they saw Him already dead, they did not break His legs.

34.verse: But one of the soldiers stabbed His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

35.verse: And the one having seen it has testified, and his testimony is true. And that one knows that he is speaking true things, so that you also may believe.

36.verse: For these things took place in order that the Scripture [in Ex 12:46] might be fulfilled: “A bone of His will not be broken”.

37.verse: And again another Scripture [Zech 12:10] says, “They will look at the One Whom they pierced”.

38.verse: Joseph Lays Jesus In a Tomb - Now after these things Joseph from Arimathea— being a disciple of Jesus, but having been hidden because of the fear of the Jews— asked Pilate in order that he might take away the body of Jesus. And Pilate permitted it. So he came and took away His body.

39.verse: And Nicodemus also came— the one having first come to Him by night— bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.

40.verse: So they took the body of Jesus and bound it in linen-cloths with the spices, as is the custom for the Jews to prepare-for-burial.

41.verse: Now there was a garden in the place where He was crucified. And in the garden was a new tomb in which no one yet had been laid.

42.verse: So there— because of the Preparation day of the Jews, because the tomb was near— they laid Jesus.

1.verse: On The First Day of the Week, Jesus Is Not Found In The Tomb - Now on the first day of the week, Mary the Magdalene goes to the tomb early-in-the-morning— there still being darkness— and sees the stone having been taken away from the tomb.

2.verse: So she runs and comes to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus was loving. And she says to them, “They took the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they put Him”.

3.verse: So Peter and the other disciple went forth, and were going to the tomb.

4.verse: And the two were running together. And the other disciple ran ahead faster than Peter, and came to the tomb first.

5.verse: And having stooped-to-look, he sees the linen-cloths lying there, but he did not enter.

6.verse: Then Simon Peter also comes, following him. And he entered into the tomb. And he sees the linen-cloths lying there,

7.verse: and the face-cloth which was on His head— not lying with the linen-cloths, but apart-from them, having been wrapped-up in one place.

8.verse: So at that time the other disciple also entered— the one having come to the tomb first— and saw and believed.

9.verse: For they did not yet understand the Scripture— that He must rise-up from the dead.

10.verse: Then the disciples went away again to them.

11.verse: Jesus Meets Mary The Magdalene And Tells Her To Announce His Resurrection - Now Mary was standing outside at the tomb, weeping. Then as she was weeping, she stooped-to-look into the tomb.

12.verse: And she sees two angels in white, sitting— one at the head and one at the feet where the body of Jesus was lying.

13.verse: And those ones say to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She says to them, “Because they took my Lord, and I do not know where they put Him”.

14.verse: Having said these things, she turned back, and sees Jesus standing there. And she did not know that it was Jesus.

15.verse: Jesus says to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?” That one, thinking that He is the gardener, says to Him, “Sir, if you carried Him away, tell me where you put Him, and I will take Him”.

16.verse: Jesus says to her, “Mary”. That one, having turned, says to Him in Hebrew, “Rabboni!” (which means, Teacher).

17.verse: Jesus says to her, “Do not be clinging-to Me, for I have not yet gone-up to the Father. But go to My brothers and say to them, ‘I am going-up to My Father and your Father, and My God and your God’”.

18.verse: Mary the Magdalene comes, announcing to the disciples that “I have seen the Lord”, and that He said these things to her.

19.verse: That Evening, Jesus Meets Ten of The Disciples And Says, Receive The Holy Spirit - Then— being evening on that first day of the week, and the doors having been locked where the disciples were because of the fear of the Jews— Jesus came and stood in their midst. And He says to them, “Peace to you”.

20.verse: And having said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples rejoiced, having seen the Lord.

21.verse: Then Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you. Just as the Father has sent Me forth, I also am sending you”.

22.verse: And having said this, He breathed-on them. And He says to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.

23.verse: If you forgive the sins of any, they have been forgiven for them. If you retain the sins of any, they have been retained”.

24.verse: After Eight Days, Jesus Meets Thomas, Who Says, My Lord And My God! - Now Thomas, one of the twelve, the one being called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

25.verse: So the other disciples were saying to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But the one said to them, “Unless I see the mark of the nails in His hands, and put my finger into the mark of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will by no means believe”.

26.verse: And after eight days, His disciples were again inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus comes— the doors having been locked. And He stood in their midst and said, “Peace to you”.

27.verse: Then He says to Thomas, “Bring your finger here and see My hands. And bring your hand and put it into My side. And do not be unbelieving, but believing”.

28.verse: Thomas responded and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”

29.verse: Jesus says to him, “You have believed because you have seen Me. Blessed are the ones not having seen and having believed”.

30.verse: Jesus Did Many Other Signs - Then indeed Jesus also did many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which have not been written in this book.

31.verse: But these things have been written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and so that believing, you may have life in His name.

1.verse: Later, Jesus Meets The Disciples By The Sea of Galilee - After these things Jesus manifested Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. And He manifested Himself as follows:

2.verse: Simon Peter, and Thomas (the one being called Didymus), and Nathanael (the one from Cana of Galilee), and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of His disciples were together.

3.verse: Simon Peter says to them, “I am going to fish”. They say to him, “We are also coming with you”. They went out and got into the boat. And during that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: Now having already become early-morning, Jesus stood at the shore. But the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.

5.verse: So Jesus says to them, “Children, you do not have any fish-to-eat, do you?” They answered Him, “No”.

6.verse: And the One said to them, “Cast the net to the right side of the boat and you will find them”. So they cast it, and they were no longer strong-enough to draw it [into the boat] because of the multitude of the fish.

7.verse: Then that disciple whom Jesus was loving says to Peter, “It is the Lord”. So Simon Peter, having heard that it was the Lord, tied his outer-garment around himself (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.

8.verse: But the other disciples came in the small-boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two-hundred cubits away)— dragging the net of fish.

9.verse: Then when they got out to the land, they see a charcoal-fire lying there, and fish lying upon it, and bread.

10.verse: Jesus says to them, “Bring from the fish which you now caught”.

11.verse: So Simon Peter went up and drew the net to land, full of large fish— a hundred fifty three. And though being so many, the net was not torn.

12.verse: Jesus says to them, “Come, eat-breakfast”. And none of the disciples was daring to question Him, “Who are You?”, knowing that it was the Lord.

13.verse: Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, and the fish likewise.

14.verse: This is now the third time Jesus was manifested to the disciples after having arisen from the dead.

15.verse: At Breakfast, Jesus Restores Peter. Do You Love Me? Feed My Sheep - Then when they ate-breakfast, Jesus says to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you devotedly-love Me more than these?” He says to Him, “Yes, Lord. You know that I affectionately-love You”. He says to him, “Be feeding My lambs”.

16.verse: He says to him again a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you devotedly-love Me?” He says to Him, “Yes, Lord. You know that I affectionately-love You”. He says to him, “Be shepherding My sheep”.

17.verse: He says to him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you affectionately-love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you affectionately-love Me?”. And he says to Him, “Lord, You know all things. You recognize that I affectionately-love You”. Jesus says to him, “Be feeding My sheep.

18.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, when you were younger you were girding yourself and walking where you were wanting to go. But when you become-old, you will stretch-out your hands and another will gird you and bring you where you are not wanting to go”.

19.verse: Now this He said signifying by what kind of death he will glorify God. And having said this, He says to him, “Be following Me!”

20.verse: Peter Asks Jesus About John - Peter, having turned around, sees the disciple following them whom Jesus was loving— the one who also leaned back on His chest during dinner and said, “Lord, who is the one handing You over?”

21.verse: So Peter, having looked-at this one, says to Jesus, “Lord, and what of this one?

22.verse: Jesus says to him, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is it to you? You be following Me!”

23.verse: Therefore this statement went out to the brothers, that “that disciple does not die”. But Jesus did not say to him that he does not die, but “If I want him to remain until I come, what is it to you?”

24.verse: John Concludes The Book - This one is the disciple testifying about these things, and the one having written these things, and we know that his testimony is true.

25.verse: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they should be written individually, I suppose that not even the world itself would have-room-for the books being written.
